msbt.message: The shape, the pattern, the color my goodness, aren't clown fish absolutely darling!
A single sparkly anchovy is pretty and all, but when they swim in a school togethertruly magnificent!
The sea butterfly floats through water like a regular butterfly floats through air. Oh, to soar like they do!
I'd love to have a big pond full of koi in my own beautiful garden What an impression that would make!
The little guppy may be a rather standard tropical fish, but they really do have a beauty I never tire of.
I find betta fish to be so artistic! Their tail is like a brilliant paintbrush splashing the water with color.
Black lines on brilliant blue with just a spot of yellowthe surgeonfish is quite a fashionable fellow, isn't he?
The stringfish is quite the introvert. In fact, it's been called the "phantom fish" because it's so elusive.
The arapaima's face looksfiendish! If I ran into one elsewhere, I wouldn't dare make eye contact.
The Napoleonfish is an odd one with its pouty lips and lumpy head. Still, I find it quite charming.
Ocean sunfish always swim so lazily. How do they ever get enough to eat? I'm worried for the poor dears!
The whale shark's mouth is gigantic, and yet it eats only tiny plankton. It is a fish of many contradictions!
I read that the arowana's shape hasn't changed since ancient times. You could say it has a timeless style!
The coelacanth was once considered extinctbut it fooled everyone! The sneaky fish is still swimming today!
The char is such a regal fish. It has the bearing of a proud prince. We shall call itPrince Char-ming! Ha!
Piranhas have such adorable little mouthsâ€”until they start eating. Then they're nothing but terrifying teeth!
I find this great white shark not only terrifyingbut also terrifyingly stylish, .
They say that mahi-mahi turn gold when they get excited. Can you imagine? I wish I could do that!
Did you know that oarfish can grow as long as a bus?! No wonder they were once mistaken for sea serpents.
You know, , they say that sturgeon can live to be 100 years old. But I don't think this one looks a day over 40.
The gar has such a cute fishy face! But behind that cute face are rows and rows of sharp, carnivorous teeth. It just goes to show, you mustn't judge a fish by its smile.
The hammerhead shark has a marvelous look, what with its bold lines and unique design.Still, if I were to meet one in the ocean, I would NOT stop to give it a compliment!
Why, that gorgeous fish was one of your donations, wasn't it? Thanks to you, we get to see it up close and personal. I'm so very grateful for that, .
